title: Motion graph - When is accel constant and nonzero

content.question: The velocity as a function of time for an object moving along a straight line is shown in the graph. For which of the following sections of the graph is the acceleration constant and nonzero?

choices.label: <math alttext="P Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>PQ</mtext></math> and <math alttext="T U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>TU</mtext></math> only
<math alttext="R S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>RS</mtext></math> and <math alttext="S T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>ST</mtext></math> only

<math alttext="P Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>PQ</mtext></math>, <math alttext="R S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>RS</mtext></math>, <math alttext="S T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>ST</mtext></math> and <math alttext="T U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>TU</mtext></math> only

content.answer: <math alttext="R S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>RS</mtext></math> and <math alttext="S T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>ST</mtext></math> only

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
